div.p: STAIRCASE, in architecture, an aſcent incloſed between walls, or a baluſtrade conſiſting of flairs or ſteps, with landing places and rails, ſerving to make a communication between the ſeveral ſtories oſ a houſe. See Architecture, n⁰ 89, &c.
